This should ensure  that the following stylesheet processing instruction is honored by  these new browser versions. For some more background you might want  to visit the following bug report:  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=338621  --> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/WebResource.axd?d=OG6ICBS3XdykvyL_wBngEtwfPZ1xqVL3SJbFznhjfEgbO7QCYjHbDfgdgnO_5IYl31FcIeZ2u_qHqs8zCgU_y6DDpKxLyAV4MxNJVxfxbqAA9wnJHfwytgbvEYfRnFp2CKySbJEfaqzaXNpSNK6oTGhGshY1&t=635319500310794128" media="screen"?> <feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:content="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">   <title>Russian and Slavonic Studies</title>   <subtitle>We are one of the leading departments of Russian and Slavonic studies in the UK in terms of teaching and research and offer a first-class learning experience in a friendly and supportive environment. Our versatile and innovative teaching programme includes a large number of modules covering a range of topics from the medieval period to the 21st century.</subtitle>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/russianandslavonicstudies/russianandslavonicstudies.aspx?RelatedItemsasStandardList_SyndicationType=2" />   <generator>Contensis: http://www.contentmanagement.co.uk</generator>   <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/russianandslavonicstudies/russianandslavonicstudies.aspx?SyndicationType=2</id>   <updated>2015-03-06T08:49:53Z</updated>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/russianandslavonicstudies/russianandslavonicstudies.aspx?SyndicationType=2" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml" />   <entry>     <title>Modern Languages BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modernlanguagesba.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>Modern Languages at The University of Nottingham are part of the School of Cultures, Languages and Area Studies (CLAS). Studying a modern language involves much more than just learning to speak the language.You will gain expertise in national and regional cultures and cover themes such as film, history, linguistics, literature, media and politics, amongst others.</summary>     <published>2014-06-10T15:45:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-05T16:22:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modernlanguagesba.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Modern Languages with Business BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-languages-business.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Jayne Holgate</name>     </author>     <summary>This course enables you to combine the study of two European languages to final degree level with a range of nonlinguistic modules and business modules.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:53:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-03T15:21:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-languages-business.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Modern Language Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-language.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>This course enables you to study three languages; you can choose three from post-A level French, German, Russian or Spanish, or two from those above along with beginners' modules in either Russian, German, Serbian/Croatian, Portuguese, Slovene, Spanish or Dutch.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:53:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-02-26T13:33:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-language.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Modern Languages</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modernlanguages.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Jayne Holgate</name>     </author>     <summary>The School received the top rating for teaching in the latest independent review of quality, and each department is internationally recognised for the standard of its research. We offer a wide range of degree subjects, flexible course structures and an extensive selection of optional modules.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:34:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-03T12:52:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modernlanguages.aspx</id>     <category term="Modern Languages" />     <category term="Modern Languages and Cultures" />     <category term="cultures" />     <category term="Languages and Area studies" />     <category term="Languages" />     <category term="Culture" />   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Modern European Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-european.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>Modern European Studies is available in three different branches: modern history and two modern languages; politics and two modern languages; or modern history, politics and one modern language.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:53:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-02-26T13:31:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/modernlanguages/modern-european.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Russian Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/russianandslavonicstudies/ba-russian.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Susie Colley</name>     </author>     <summary>This course offers the study of Russian language and culture, providing you with the high-level linguistic, analytical and presentation skills that prepare you for a wide range of careers. You will also get the unique opportunity to take a two-week subsidised course in Russia during the first-year summer vacation to prepare you for your year abroad.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:53:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-05T15:26:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/russianandslavonicstudies/ba-russian.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>History and East European Cultural Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/russianandslavonicstudies/history-russian-east-european-civilisations.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Susie Colley</name>     </author>     <summary>This course combines history with the study of East European Cultural Studies. You will develop skills for writing and debating history, and you will plan, research and write an analysis of an area of historiography of your choice to develop independence of mind and critical abilities.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:55:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-02-26T14:32:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/russianandslavonicstudies/history-russian-east-european-civilisations.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Russian and Contemporary Chinese Studies BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/russianandslavonicstudies/russian-contemporary-chinese.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>This course offers you the opportunity to combine studies in Russian and Chinese languages, literatures, histories and cultures. There are options to study Serbian/Croatian, Slovene and Polish as part of the course, and the year abroad gives you a unique opportunity to practise your language skills and enhance your understanding of the Russian and Chinese cultures.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T17:54:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-04T13:44:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/russianandslavonicstudies/russian-contemporary-chinese.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Economics with Russian BA</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-russian.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>The aim of this degree is to produce high-quality economic analysts who are fluent in a language, rather than linguists with some training in economics. As a result, you will study the same core economics modules as those taking BA (Hons) Economics.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:06:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-11-07T15:45:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/economics/economics-russian.aspx</id>   </entry> </feed>
